sub_topic: Using the unit circle to find trigonometric values
message_1: What is the value of the sine, cosine, and tangent of an angle in degrees of 45°, when measured counterclockwise from the positive x-axis on the unit circle?
message_2:
For an angle of 45° (or π/4 in radians), the sine, cosine, and tangent values are as follows:

sin(45°) = sin(π/4) = √2/2 ≈ 0.7071

cos(45°) = cos(π/4) = √2/2 ≈ 0.7071

tan(45°) = tan(π/4) = sin(π/4) / cos(π/4) = (√2/2) / (√2/2) = 1

So, sin(45°) ≈ 0.7071, cos(45°) ≈ 0.7071, and tan(45°) = 1.
